title.narrative: Integrated emergency package response to catastrophic affected population of Jalalaqsi districts in Hiran Region.

description.narrative: RRP through this interventions in the stated localities will work towards Strengthen and improve access to essential lifesaving health services aimed at reducing avoidable morbidity and mortality, reduction of maternal and child deaths and strengthen emergency preparedness and response capacity at all levels in order to mitigate and respond to communicable disease outbreaks in an efficient, coordinated, and timely manner for crisis affected and host populations in Jalalaqsi district of Hiran region Somalia. As a way of working towards provision of Integrated life-saving primary health care services We will improve access to health care systems by providing health interventions to the residence through consultation and management of childhood illnesses with an aim of reducing maternal and neonatal mortality which will be given focus. Staff and the community will be equipped with adequate skills through training. RRP will therefore integrate this by providing treatment of Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM) through OTP (Outpatient Therapeutic) services in line with the Basic Nutrition Service Package (BNSP) of up to 1 fixed and 2 outreaches in Jalalaqsi district. RRP will train and support nutrition workers to identify, provide lifesaving treatment and follow up on cases of malnutrition. RRP will also integrate preventative services including providing Infant Youth and Child Feeding (IYCF) counselling, micro nutrients supplementation at MCHs and routine immunization. Community level social mobilization will be done to promote healthy nutritional practices, including campaigns for micro nutrient supplementation, deworming, and improved feeding practices. RRP will actively participate in both national and Hiran Beletweyne regional cluster meetings. Participation of the community groups such as women, youth, and local leaders will be prioritized so as to enhance and get more feedback as an aspect of accountability to the affected population. RRP will do monthly, quarterly, midyear and end year reporting. RRP will work towards reduction of the high prevalence of SAM and MAM in the district. hence reducing mortality and morbidity rates related to malnutrition and improve, provide and integrated, nutrition related resilience interventions lifesaving and quality nutrition services to acutely malnourished children and PLWs through community based nutritional service. Increase access and utilization of BNSP, MCH services to acutely malnourished boys’ girls U5, and PLW and integrate WASH services. Capacity building to the community health workers, volunteers, care givers and field staff and strengthen the existing community-based nutrition service structures to provide comprehensive basic nutritional service packages (BNSP) to malnourished children U5 and PLW in the two districts. The lack of essential WASH services means serious public health risks and preventable deaths. The project shall promote the equitable participation of both men and women in the planning and decision-making processes, this will ultimately help to ensure that the entire affected population has safe and easy access to water supply, sanitation facilities and services, and that such services and facilities are appropriate. The main objective of this intervention is to provide safe drinking water and even to improve on the sanitation aspect of the residence in the target districts. We also intent to reduce the transmission of and exposure to water borne diseases (AWD/cholera) among targeted at risk and vulnerable IDP populations. This shall be achieved through the provision of access to safe water, adequate and appropriate sanitation facilities and services. The project also aims to ensure that the targeted communities are sensitized, mobilized on best practices to prevent water and sanitation related diseases (AWD/cholera). All will be offered at community and facility level to reach all.
